title: Maruti Suzuki's 2Q Net Profit Fell 39% on Year
text:
By Kosaku Narioka

Maruti Suzuki India Ltd. (532500.BY), one of India's biggest car companies, on Thursday said second-quarter net profit fell 39% from a year ago as vehicle sales dropped.

Consolidated net profit in the July-to-September quarter fell to 13.91 billion Indian rupees ($196.7 million), from INR22.80 billion a year ago, the company said in a stock exchange filing.

Sales for various vehicle types fell across the board, while tax expenses dropped.

Standalone second-quarter net profit was INR13.59 billion, exceeding analysts' estimate of INR10.22 billion, according to FactSet.

Group revenue fell to INR169.98 billion, from INR224.44 billion a year ago.
